It was therefore on the lst of September, 100, that Pliny ' delivered his Panegyric, the usual speech of thanks to the Emperor made by one of the consuls on the day of their entry on office. The Panegyric is the only specimen we have of Pliny’s oratory, and it can hardly be called a pure specimen, for it under- went repeated revision3 and careful recasting before its publication.
